meanings.definition: A projecting part of a fortification built at an angle to the line of a wall, so as to allow defensive fire in several directions.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had strong bastions that protected it from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers took cover behind the bastions to shield themselves from the enemy's arrows.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the bird feeder was a bastion of delicious nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering faith was a bastion against the storms of doubt in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The towering bastions of the fortress loomed over the surrounding landscape.
